JobTitle: Sales Operations Program Associate,  New Verticals
JobFullDesc: ABOUT THE ROLEWith New Verticals, we're building Uber's fastest growing, and our next 10^10, business. Global in scope, with a focus on our largest potential grocery and other new verticals markets, the team is responsible for all grocery and new verticals operations/sales/strategy across markets and also manages our integrated operations and efforts with Cornershop. Today, our focus is on the 10 priority markets of the US, Canada, Brazil, Chile, Mexico, UK, FR, Australia, Japan and Taiwan. This scrappy, nimble and high performing team is tasked with building a sustainable high growth business as we expand from restaurants to other high growth verticals. We are looking to hire an Associate Program Manager who is passionate about building and scaling our Sales Operations function within New Verticals, Uber's fastest growing business. This role will focus on driving key pivotal initiatives to optimize launch and go-to-market, increase sales productivity, and support aggressive OKRs in a nascent sector of the Uber Delivery portfolio.WHAT YOU'LL DOStrategy - Develop and execute initiatives against the overall sales org strategy. This includes a continuous review of our go-to-market model as well as building a "market leader" plan to help make us #1 in markets where we have strong product/market fit and high CPExperiment - Organize pilot programs that measure select variables to inform decision-making. Run sales tests and lead market intelligence efforts to evolve our prospecting targets, our segmentation, customer retention, and top of the funnel lead scoring. You will own and drive key strategic product pilotsOptimize - Build a customer acquisition engine to better target prospects, partnering with our data science team and external vendorsAnalyze - Build models to evaluate the economics, value, and opportunity costs of programs intended to multiply sales headcount productivityInfluence - Manage cross-functional projects with our sales, operations, product, engineering, S&P, and systems teams to drive strategy and achieve targetsBASIC QUALIFICATIONS2+ years of experience in strategy, operations or project/program managementExperience with Salesforce.com (SFDC) and other contact relationship management tools (CRM's) and datasetsProficiency in SQLPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSSkilled ability communicating with technical and non-technical audiencesAbility to build consensus with cross-functional partnersExperience with customer acquisition, account management, and support processes, systems, and datasetsAnalytical orientation, with an aptitude for framing business questions with data, translating business needs into strategies, and executing tactics and process improvements.Experience working with large sets of unstructured data and synthesizing into business insights (e.g., using SQL, Excel, Salesforce).Detail oriented with a focus on accuracy and process standardization using strong documentation. You lean in and embrace the details to map processes, clean data, and even review code!You are skilled at project management such that you can easily balance urgent versus important requests, and you flourish with ambiguity.You must be a self-starter and able to work independently.
